```
sage: GammaH(14,[10])
Congruence Subgroup Gamma_H(14) with H generated by [10]
```

archive/issue_comments_053047.json:
```json
{
    "body": "<a id='comment:2'></a>This looks fine, it applies to 4.1.1 and the tests (in the directory modular/arithgroup) pass.\n\nSuggestion:  there is already a function _normalize_H(H, level) which checks that H is a list, reduces its entries modulo the level, sorts and deletes 1 if present.  Why not add the gcd test in there?  I would not mak a lot of difference, but the code would be tidier that way.",
    "created_at": "2009-08-30T16:47:28Z",
    "issue": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/6425",
    "type": "issue_comment",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/6425#issuecomment-53047",
    "user": "https://github.com/JohnCremona"
}
```

<a id='comment:2'></a>This looks fine, it applies to 4.1.1 and the tests (in the directory modular/arithgroup) pass.

Suggestion:  there is already a function _normalize_H(H, level) which checks that H is a list, reduces its entries modulo the level, sorts and deletes 1 if present.  Why not add the gcd test in there?  I would not mak a lot of difference, but the code would be tidier that way.
